alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for maternity suspension payments
body:
$!As an employer, paying an employee their normal wages while they're on maternity suspension counts as earnings. $!

You must:

* add the payments to the employee’s other earnings
* deduct and pay PAYE tax and National Insurance through payroll

^An employee who’s pregnant, has recently given birth or is breastfeeding may be suspended from work on maternity grounds if her continued attendance could damage her, or her baby's, health.^

##Technical guidance

The following guides contain more detailed information:

* [employment protection legislation](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/eim02550.htm "Employment protection legislation"){:rel="external"}

* [Class 1 National Insurance: maternity suspension payments](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/nimmanual/nim07016.htm "Class 1 National Insurance: maternity suspension payments"){:rel="external"}

*[PAYE]:Pay As You Earn
